info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 27 at 2:09PM CDT until August 29 at 3:16PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Verdigris River at Altoona affecting Wilson County.
Verdigris River at Independence affecting Montgomery and Wilson Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Verdigris River at Altoona.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Expect flooding of agricultural fields and gravel road near the river bridge off of Highway 47.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 3.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 19.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON
